@jtmhom88 I was able to reproduce the issue with the data you provided. There is indeed a bug, it is related to not being able to read all rows from existing input segments in some cases, I will be sending patch to fix that soon.
Thank-you for confirming that. I look forward to downloading the patch. Cheers!
@himanshug Can you update the title of this issue to better reflect the bug?
IngestSegmentFirehose fails to read all rows from segment which results in batch delta ingestion producing partial data from existing dataSource interval specified.
Do you have an approximate ETA on the patch?

OK. I posted a request for ETA. Waiting for reply.

@jtmhom88 is it possible for you to build java-utils with https://github.com/metamx/java-util/pull/32 and use that in your cluster and verify that it fixes the issue?

I looked at the source code of the latest release https://github.com/druid-io/druid/releases/tag/druid-0.8.1
I don't see the source file ConcatSequence.java as part of the build.
I'm not quite sure what you want me to do with the metamx/java-util#32 that you're pointing out. 
Sorry, can you give me more explanation?

@jtmhom88 ConcatSequence.java is not part of core druid source code but a library called "java-util" to which PR https://github.com/metamx/java-util/pull/32 is made. One way to try it out would be to git clone java-util project, apply that patch and do a "mvn clean install" which will create and place java-utils-0.27.4-SNAPSHOT.jar in your local maven repository.
then in the druid code, update pom.xml make following change..

```
-        <metamx.java-util.version>0.27.3</metamx.java-util.version>
+        <metamx.java-util.version>0.27.4-SNAPSHOT</metamx.java-util.version>
```

then do a mvn clean install from base directory of druid code and that will produce the druid uber jar in services/target/, you can use that to run druid.

That said, I've tested the patch to be working.

@jtmhom88 since java-util-0.27.4 is released now, you can get the fix only by changing druid code base pom.xml

```
-        <metamx.java-util.version>0.27.3</metamx.java-util.version>
+        <metamx.java-util.version>0.27.4</metamx.java-util.version>
```

`DruidCoordinatorTest.testCoordinatorRun:349 expected:<1> but was:<0>`

:+1: 

Very minor risk if someone is using this exception in an extension and uses `%s` or `%d` or similar in the message. Prior version would not have an issue but this version would fail due to now-missing arguments.

`io.druid.segment.incremental.OffheapIncrementalIndex#outOfRowsReason` is the most notable risk area. Would it be possible to change `io/druid/segment/incremental/OffheapIncrementalIndex.java:190` to `new IndexSizeExceededException("%s", getOutOfRowsReason());` ? (non-blocking)

@drcrallen I don't see why OffheapIncrementalIndex.java:190 needs to change.
new IndexSizeExceededException("blah") is totally valid.
I suppose in the unlikely event that the out of rows reason is "oh no 100%disk full"
:+1: tho
@gianm @drcrallen oh, got it... will change that just to be safe then.
